data.title: Survival (song)
data.meta_description: Composed by: Bob Marley Lyrics by: Bob Marley Produced by: Bob Marley & The Wailers, Alex Sadkin Year: 1979 Length: 3:54 Musical key: A minor Recorded at: Tuff Gong Studios, Kingston, Jamaica Released on following albums: Survival (1979; remastered 2001) Released on following compilations: Songs...
data.text:
Facts[]

Original version[]

Composed by: Bob Marley

Lyrics by: Bob Marley

Produced by: Bob Marley & The Wailers, Alex Sadkin

Year: 1979

Length: 3:54

Musical key: A minor

Recorded at: Tuff Gong Studios, Kingston, Jamaica

Released on following albums: Survival (1979; remastered 2001)

Released on following compilations: Songs Of Freedom (1992)

Lineup:

Bob Marley, lead vocals, rhythm guitar, acoustic guitar

Aston Barrett, bass

Carlton Barrett, drums

Alvin "Seeco" Patterson, percussion

Tyrone Downie, keyboards, backing vocals

Earl "Wya" Lindo, keyboards, backing vocals

Al Anderson, lead guitar

Junior Marvin, lead guitar, backing vocals

The I-Threes, backing vocals

Dean Fraser, tenor saxophone

"Deadly" Headly Bennett, alto saxophone

Ronald "Nambo" Robinson, trombone

Melba Liston, trombone

Luther Francois, trombone

Junior "Chico" Chin, trumpet

Jackie Willacy, trumpet

Micky Hanson, trumpet

Period of performances: 1979

1999 hip hop remix version[]

Live performances[]

1979-11-13: Uptown Theater, Chicago, IL (USA)

Rehearsal performances[]

1979-xx-xx Survival Rehearsal: Tuff Gong Studios, Kingston (JAM)

Demo appearances[]

Trivia[]

also called "Black Survival", "Survivors" or "Black Survivors".

Translations[]

[]

Sing365.com - Original lyrics of "Survival"
